subject: Technology
title: Cord-Cutting: The Cable Exodus
description: A quick win: understand Cord-Cutting: The Cable Exodus.

hook.text: Cable TV has lost over 50 million subscribers since its peak. People are canceling at record rates with no plans to return.

buildup.text: Cable bundles forced you to pay for 200 channels to get the 10 you actually watched. Streaming let you choose.

discovery.text: Younger generations never subscribed to cable at all. They grew up with YouTube and Netflix as their default.

twist.text: Live sports remain cable's last stronghold. The moment major leagues move fully to streaming, cable's reason to exist vanishes.

climax.text: Cable companies now make more money from internet service than TV subscriptions. They're becoming utilities, not media companies.

punchline.text: Cable built the internet pipes that streaming used to destroy cable.

quiz.question: What is cable TV's last major advantage over streaming?
